Literature Review: The integration of machine learning and digital measurement technologies has revolutionized the field of psychology, enabling the development of novel methods for quantifying psychological functioning and drawing clinical inferences. This review aims to provide an overview of the theoretical foundations and scientific advances in remote sensor technology and machine learning models as they are applied to digital phenotyping, identifying digital biomarkers, and advancing psychometrics.

References.title: Digital Phenotyping: A New Frontier in Psychiatric Research
Machine Learning for Mental Health: A Systematic Review
Digital Biomarkers for Psychiatric Disorders: A Systematic Review
Machine Learning in Clinical Psychology: A Review of the Literature
Remote Sensor Technology for Mental Health: A Systematic Review
Psychometric Properties of Digital Measures of Psychological Health
